securitybug.similarityuniformfuzzyhash

Class VisualRepresentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • securitybug.similarityuniformfuzzyhash.VisualRepresentation

  • public final class VisualRepresentation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility static methods to represent and compare Uniform Fuzzy Hashes in visual way.
    Author:
    s3curitybug@gmail.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.nio.charset.Charset BASES_ENCODING
      Charset in which bases are encoded.

      Default base.
      static int DEFAULT_FACTOR_DIVISOR
      Default factor divisor.
      static int DEFAULT_LINE_WRAP
      Default line wrap.
      static char[] PRINTABLE_ASCII_BASE
      Printable ASCII base.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void print(UniformFuzzyHash hash)
      Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, using the default base, factor divisor and line wrap.
      static void print(UniformFuzzyHash hash, char[] base, int factorDivisor, int lineWrap, boolean concatenatePercent)
      Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way.
      static void printCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1, UniformFuzzyHash hash2)
      Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not, and using the default base, factor divisor, and line wrap.
      static void printCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1, UniformFuzzyHash hash2, char[] base, int factorDivisor, int lineWrap, boolean concatenatePercent)
      Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not.

      Represents a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, using the default base and factor divisor.

    • Method Detail

      • represent

        public static java.lang.String represent(UniformFuzzyHash hash)
        Represents a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, using the default base and factor divisor.
        Parameters:
        hash - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        Returns:
        A string representing the introduced Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way.

      • represent

        public static java.lang.String represent(UniformFuzzyHash hash,
                                         char[] base,
                                         int factorDivisor)
        Represents a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way.
        Parameters:
        hash - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        base - The characters base which will be used to represent the blocks.
        factorDivisor - Amount of characters per factor size for each block.
        Returns:
        A string representing the introduced Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way.

      • representCompared

        public static java.lang.String representCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1,
                                                 UniformFuzzyHash hash2)
        Represents a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not, and using the default base and factor divisor.
        Parameters:
        hash1 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        hash2 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash to which the first one will be compared.
        Returns:
        A string representing the introduced Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, with ANSI color characters.

      • representCompared

        public static java.lang.String representCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1,
                                                 UniformFuzzyHash hash2,
                                                 char[] base,
                                                 int factorDivisor)
        Represents a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not.
        Parameters:
        hash1 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        hash2 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash to which the first one will be compared.
        base - The characters base which will be used to represent the blocks.
        factorDivisor - Amount of characters per factor size for each block.
        Returns:
        A string representing the introduced Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, with ANSI color characters.

      • print

        public static void print(UniformFuzzyHash hash)
        Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, using the default base, factor divisor and line wrap.
        Parameters:
        hash - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.

      • print

        public static void print(UniformFuzzyHash hash,
                         char[] base,
                         int factorDivisor,
                         int lineWrap,
                         boolean concatenatePercent)
        Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way.
        Parameters:
        hash - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        base - The characters base which will be used to represent the blocks.
        factorDivisor - Amount of characters per factor size for each block.
        lineWrap - Amount of characters per line. If this argument is lower than 1, no line wrap is performed and the full representation is printed in one line.
        concatenatePercent - In case line wrap is performed, true to concatenate to each line its relative percent to the total length.

      • printCompared

        public static void printCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1,
                                 UniformFuzzyHash hash2)
        Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not, and using the default base, factor divisor, and line wrap.
        Parameters:
        hash1 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        hash2 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash to which the first one will be compared.

      • printCompared

        public static void printCompared(UniformFuzzyHash hash1,
                                 UniformFuzzyHash hash2,
                                 char[] base,
                                 int factorDivisor,
                                 int lineWrap,
                                 boolean concatenatePercent)
        Prints a Uniform Fuzzy Hash in a visual way, coloring the blocks which are present in another Uniform Fuzzy Hash with a different color to the ones which are not.
        Parameters:
        hash1 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash.
        hash2 - The Uniform Fuzzy Hash to which the first one will be compared.
        base - The characters base which will be used to represent the blocks.
        factorDivisor - Amount of characters per factor size for each block.
        lineWrap - Amount of characters per line. If this argument is lower than 1, no line wrap is performed and the full representation is printed in one line.
        concatenatePercent - In case line wrap is performed, true to concatenate to each line its relative percent to the total length.
